nodes.text: Yalbec Prime was a location in the galaxy. During the Clone Wars, the Republic's Clone Force 99, an elite group of clone troopers, were sent to put down an insurrection on Yalbec Prime, but complications arose when a member of the group, known as Wrecker, cut off the stinger of a Yalbec queen. Various male Yalbec then tried to mate with them, but the group eventually managed to leave Yalbec Prime and travel to the planet Anaxes for their next mission.

During the Imperial Era, crime boss Sorc Tormo of the Haxion Brood used the phrase "uglier than mating season on Yalbec Prime" while commentating on combat in his fighting pit on the Haxion Brood's asteroid stronghold Ordo Eris.

Yalbec Prime was first mentioned in "The Bad Batch," an episode of the Star Wars: The Clone Wars television series. The episode was written to be the premiere of the show's seventh season, but The Clone Wars was canceled before it was made and released. The unfinished story reels of the episodes were then shown at Celebration Anaheim in 2015, before being released on StarWars.com later that year as part of The Clone Wars Legacy.[source?]
It was later mentioned once more in Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, in which the spelling of the location was clarified.
